cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles NNW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to slow, drift west/southwest in the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and then turn north toward Florida’s eastern Gulf Coast later this week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida eastern Gulf Coast (Big Bend or Nature Coast area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch remains only for portions of west Cuba; none for southeast Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Brevard/Volusia County line (east-central FL) around Florida peninsula to Anna Maria Island, Keys, and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula and Florida Keys experiencing strong winds, heavy rain, and minor surge
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, higher gusts) possible through Monday morning before diminishing
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the southeast Florida coast near Port Everglades, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches with locally higher totals; saturated ground may lead to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents/surf along the Atlantic beaches
